page.title: Reference
page.paragraph: This section lists out all the Partials and the variables that are made available to them. The Partials are all written using Freemarker. You can find the reference for Freemarker here .
page.title: Flex Item
page.paragraph: Many Widgets fall into the specific category of being a Flex Item. This kind of Widget describes a Widget that will be composed within a Flex Container. The combination of Flex Items and Flex Containers allows for a high degree of control over positioning of HTML elements within one another.
These are the supported attributes that are applicable to Flex Item Widgets specified in Page Definition files.

cell.paragraph: The alignSelf attribute is translated into the HTML flex-box align-self attribute.

row.cell: AUTO, START, CENTER, END, STRETCH, BASELINE

cell.paragraph: The flexBasis attribute is translated into the HTML flex-box flex-basis attribute.
The height attribute is translated into the HTML height attribute.
The width attribute is translated into the HTML width attribute.
The flexGrow attribute is translated into the flex-grow flexbox attribute.
The flexShrink attribute is translated into the flex-shrink flexbox attribute.
The hiddenScript attribute is used to specify a Plantain Script that returns a boolean that indicates if the element should be hidden or not.
The margin attribute is translated to the margin attribute in the HTML page.
The padding attribute is translated to the padding attribute in the HTML page.

The backgroundFlavour attribute is translated into a class that is applied to the element in the HTML. PRIMARY, for example, is translated into a 'bg-primary' class. It's the responsibility of the web developer to make sure all of these classes are available for use: bg-default, bg-primary, bg-info, bg-warning, bg-danger,bg-success, bg-muted, bg-black and bg-white.

row.cell: DEFAULT, PRIMARY, INFO, WARNING, DANGER, SUCCESS, MUTED, BLACK, WHITE

cell.paragraph: The borderRadius property will be translated to border-radius in the HTML.

page.title: Flex Container
page.paragraph: Many Widgets compose or contain other Widgets and need to control how child Widgets are organised. These Widgets are Flex Containers. Flex Containers are very probably translated into flex containers are per the HTML flexbox standard.
These are the supported attributes that are applicable to Flex Container Widgets specified in Page Definition files.

cell.paragraph: The orientation property, translated as the flex-orientation property as per the flexbox specification, controls the axis in which children are presented.
As per the flexbox specification, the justifyContent property is translated as the justify-content css attribute.

row.cell: START, CENTER, END, SPACE_BETWEEN, SPACE_AROUND, SPACE_EVENLY

cell.paragraph: As per the flexbox specification, the alignItems property is translated as the align-items css attribute.

row.cell: AUTO, START, CENTER, END, STRETCH, BASELINE

cell.paragraph: As per the flexbox specification, the wrap property is translated as the wrap css attribute.
As per the flexbox specification, the alignContent property is translated as the align-content css attribute.

row.cell: AUTO, START, CENTER, END, STRETCH, BASELINE

cell.paragraph: The padding property is translated as the padding property in HTML.

page.title: Textual
page.paragraph: Many Widgets present text and as such have a common set of attributes that affect the styling of the text within. These Widgets are collectively referred to as the Textuals. In addition to having presentation attributes, Textuals also compose specific elements related to text. These are Span, Br and Script. These elements are laid out in flowing order as you would expect text to be laid out in a paragraph. Elements are wrapped when space is constrained.
These are the supported attributes that are applicable to Textual Widgets specified in Page Definition files.

row.cell: The fontFlavour specifies the colouring of the font.
DEFAULT, PRIMARY, INFO, WARNING, DANGER, SUCCESS, MUTED, BLACK, WHITE
The backgroundFlavour specifies the colouring of the background flavour.
DEFAULT, PRIMARY, INFO, WARNING, DANGER, SUCCESS, MUTED, BLACK, WHITE

The font attribute specifies one of a limited set of font faces. These names are translated into font faces that are specified in the class mappings file (class-mappings.properties). The actual names are font-title-primary, font-title-secondary, font-text-primary, font-text-secondary, font-exhibit, font-primary and font-secondary.
TITLE_PRIMARY, TITLE_SECONDARY, TEXT_PRIMARY, TEXT_SECONDARY, EXHIBIT, PRIMARY, SECONDARY
The textAlign property is translated into the text-align property in HTML.
The fontSize property specifies the font size.
The textDecoration translates to the text-decoration css attribute.
OVERLINE, LINE_THROUGH, UNDERLINE, UNSET, INITIAL, INHERIT
The fontStyle translates to the font-style css attribute.
NORMAL, ITALIC, OBLIQUE, UNSET, INHERIT, INITIAL
The fontWeight translates to the font-weight css attribute.
NORMAL, BOLD, LIGHTER, BOLDER, INHERIT, INITIAL, UNSET

page.title: Accordion
page.paragraph: The Accordion Widget presents a collapsed stack of panels where each panel has a header that can be clicked to expand the panel. Typically, there is an animation that expands or collapses the panel and hence the name.

The Accordion can be viewed on the right hand side of the
Style Guide Portfolio
page.
page.title: Widget
page.paragraph: The Widget has, in addition to being a Flex Item, the following attributes.

cell.paragraph: The flush property will specify that the Accordion should appear flush-to-the-page when presented. This typically means that the borders and background colors of the panels are suppressed.
The singleActive property specifies that only one panel should be expanded at a time.

page.title: Template
page.paragraph: The template for the Accordion is the accordion.ftl file. It takes the following tokens.

cell.paragraph: A unique id.
A list of classes that should be applied.
The css styles that should be applied in order to support Flex Item definitions.
The rendered output of the children of this widget.
The flush property will specify that the Accordion should appear flush-to-the-page when presented. This typically means that the borders and background colors of the panels are suppressed.

page.title: Accordion Item
page.paragraph: The Accordion Item Widget presents a panel as a part of an Accordion Widget. This element must be the immediate child of an Accordion element.

The Accordion Item can be viewed on the right hand side of the
Style Guide Portfolio
page.
page.title: Widget
page.paragraph: The Widget has, in addition to being a Flex Container, the following attributes.

cell.paragraph: This property specifies that this Accordion Item is active when the page is first presented.
The backgroundFlavour property specifies the background colour of the header of the Accordion Item.

row.cell: DEFAULT, PRIMARY, INFO, WARNING, DANGER, SUCCESS, MUTED, BLACK, WHITE

page.title: Template
page.paragraph: The template for the Accordion Item is the accordion-item.ftl file. It takes the following tokens.

cell.paragraph: A unique id.
A list of classes that should be applied.
The css styles that should be applied in order to support Flex Container definitions.
The rendered output of the children of this widget.
Specifies the header content.
Specifies if the current item is active or expanded.
Specifies if the Accordion only allows one item to be active at a time.

page.title: Accordion Item Header
page.paragraph: The Accordion Item Header Widget specifies a header as a part of the Accordion Item. It is a mandatory child of an Accordion Item.
page.title: Widget
page.paragraph: The Accordion Item Header Widget has, in addition to being a Textual, the following attributes.

cell.paragraph: This property specifies that this Accordion Item is active when the page is first presented.
The backgroundFlavour property specifies the background colour of the header of the Accordion Item.

row.cell: DEFAULT, PRIMARY, INFO, WARNING, DANGER, SUCCESS, MUTED, BLACK, WHITE

page.title: Template
page.paragraph: The template for the Accordion Item Header is the accordion-item-header.ftl file. It takes the following tokens.

cell.paragraph: The id of the containing Accordion.
A list of classes that should be applied.
The css styles that should be applied in order to support Textual definitions.
Specifies if the current containing Accordion Item is active or expanded.

page.title: Back Link
page.paragraph: The Back Link specifies a back-link on the page that will direct the browser to revert to the previous web page.

The Back Link can be viewed at the top left of the
Style Guide Question
page.
page.title: Widget
page.paragraph: The Widget is a Flex Item. There are no additional properties.
page.title: Template
page.paragraph: The template for the widget is the back-link.ftl file. It takes the following tokens.

cell.paragraph: A unique id for the widget.
The css styles that should be applied in order to support Flex Item definitions.
The testMode token indicates if the widget should render in test mode, which typically disables any button or link clicks.

page.title: Badge
page.paragraph: The Badge Widget specifies a Textual element intended to display a simple message as a number or a one-word sentence. It is mean't to qualify some other element. Words like 'To do', or 'New' are appropriate.

The Badge Widget can be viewed on the
Style Guide Alpha
page.
page.title: Widget
page.paragraph: The Badge Widget has, in addition to being a Textual, the following attributes.

cell.paragraph: This property specifies the size.
The flavour property specifies the colouring of the Badge.

row.cell: DEFAULT, PRIMARY, INFO, WARNING, DANGER, SUCCESS, MUTED, BLACK, WHITE

page.title: Template
page.paragraph: The template for the widget is the badge.ftl file. It takes the following tokens.

cell.paragraph: A unique id for the widget.
A list of classes that should be applied.
The size of the Badge.
The css styles that should be applied in order to support Flex Item definitions.
The css styles that should be applied in order to support Textual definitions.
The content of the Badge.

page.title: Br
page.paragraph: The Br Widget introduces a forced line break into a Textual element. This Widget is only valid when composed within a Textual.
page.title: Widget
page.paragraph: There are no additional properties.
page.title: Template
page.paragraph: The template for the widget is the br.ftl file.
page.title: Button
page.paragraph: The Button Widget specifies a button for presentation on a web page as a part of a Form. This element is only valid within a Wizard. It should not be part of any predefined page. Buttons define the (submit) buttons on all pages within a Wizard that direct the user forward in the journey.

The Button Widget can be viewed on the
Style Guide Delta
page.
page.title: Widget
page.paragraph: The Button Widget is both a Textual and a Flex Item. And has the following additional properties.

cell.paragraph: The type of the Button. There are a number of types, and they are all defined and controlled by the Admin Console. From the perspective of the Materials, the Button Widget needs to be styled, but because it cannot be included in any predefined page, apart from the Style Guides, the actual meaning of the attribute is not required.
Similar to type, the actual meaning of this is not required, by the Materials.
Similar to type, the actual meaning of this is not required, by the Materials.
The size of the button.
Similar to type, the actual meaning of this is not required, by the Materials.
The colouring of the Button Widget.

row.cell: DEFAULT, PRIMARY, INFO, WARNING, DANGER, SUCCESS, MUTED, BLACK, WHITE

cell.paragraph: This attribute contains a Plantain script that will determine if the Widget should appear disabled or not.
This attribute contains a Plantain script that will determine if the Widget should appear hidden or not.

page.title: Template
page.paragraph: The template for the widget is the button.ftl file. It takes the following tokens.

cell.paragraph: A id for the button. This must be included in order for some of the button functionality to work.
A name for the button. This must be included in order for some of the button functionality to work.
A list of classes that should be applied.
The size of the widget.
The css styles that should be applied in order to support Flex Item definitions.
The css styles that should be applied in order to support Textual definitions.
The content of the widget.
The testMode token indicates if the widget should render in test mode, which typically disables any button or link clicks.

The runningWizardTest token indicates if the widget is currently being rendered as a part of a Wizard test. This situation matters because when we are running a Page test, we want the button to be disabled, but when we run in Wizard test mode, we want the button to work.
The disabled token indicates if the button should be disabled or not.

page.title: Card
page.paragraph: The Card Widget specifies a Card; a common HTML presentational element that appears as a card on the page. It can typically have a header, an image, a body and a footer section.

The Card Widget can be viewed on the
Style Guide Alpha
page.
page.title: Widget
page.paragraph: The Card Widget has, in addition to being a Flex Item, the following attributes.

cell.paragraph: The flavour property specifies the colouring of the Badge.

row.cell: DEFAULT, PRIMARY, INFO, WARNING, DANGER, SUCCESS, MUTED, BLACK, WHITE

cell.paragraph: The view property specifies which internal page to link to if the card is a link.
The url property specifies an external url that this card will link to.
The openNewWindow property will specify if, when clicked, the browser will present the destination view or url in a separate window.

page.title: Template
page.paragraph: The template for the widget is the card.ftl file. It takes the following tokens.

cell.paragraph: A unique id for the widget.
A boolean value indicating if the card should be clickable, and link to another page.
The href property specifies the value for the href property if this Card is a link. If the href property is not present, then the Card is not a link.
The value for the rel attribute if the Card is a link.
The value for the target attribute if the Card is a link.
A list of classes that should be applied.
The html content for the header of the Card.
The html content for the image of the Card.
The html content for the body of the Card.
The html content for the footer of the Card.
The css styles that should be applied in order to support Flex Item definitions.

page.title: Card Body
page.paragraph: The Card Body Widget specifies the contents of the Card Body. This section of the Card's content will present below the Card Header or Image (if any), and above the Card Footer.

The Card Body Widget can be viewed on the
Style Guide Alpha
page.
page.title: Widget
page.paragraph: The Card Body Widget is a Flex Container.
page.title: Template
page.paragraph: The template for the widget is the card-body.ftl file. It takes the following tokens.

cell.paragraph: A unique id for the widget.
The css styles that should be applied in order to support Flex Container definitions.
The html content for the widget.

page.title: Card Footer
page.paragraph: The Card Header Widget specifies the contents of the Card Footer.

The Card Footer Widget can be viewed on the
Style Guide Alpha
page.
page.title: Widget
page.paragraph: The Card Footer Widget is a Flex Container.
page.title: Template
page.paragraph: The template for the widget is the card-footer.ftl file. It takes the following tokens.

cell.paragraph: A unique id for the widget.
The css styles that should be applied in order to support Flex Container definitions.
The html content for the widget.

page.title: Card Header
page.paragraph: The Card Header Widget specifies the contents of the Card Header.

The Card Header Widget can be viewed on the
Style Guide Alpha
page.
page.title: Widget
page.paragraph: The Card Header Widget is a Flex Container.
page.title: Template
page.paragraph: The template for the widget is the card-header.ftl file. It takes the following tokens.

cell.paragraph: A unique id for the widget.
The css styles that should be applied in order to support Flex Container definitions.
The html content for the widget.

page.title: Carousel
page.paragraph: The Carousel Widget specifies a widget that presents a number of panels. The user can navigate to the next or previous panels using slide indicators. If the last panel is reached, then the user is returned to the first panel when the appropriate slide indicator is selected.

The Card Header Widget can be viewed on the
Style Guide Landing
page.
page.title: Widget
page.paragraph: The Carousel Widget is a Flex Item, in addition to having the following properties.

cell.paragraph: The autoSlide property indicates if the Carousel should automatically rotate the panels.
The indicators property specifies if there should be a series of buttons in the panel that allows direct selection of the panels.
The controls property specifies if there should be a Select Next or Select Previous set of buttons present on the Carousel.

page.title: Template
page.paragraph: The template for the widget is the carousel.ftl file. It takes the following tokens.

cell.paragraph: A unique id for the widget.
A list of classes that should be applied.
The css styles that should be applied in order to support Flex Item definitions.
The autoSlide token indicates if the Carousel should automatically rotate or cycle through its panels.
The controls token indicates if the Carousel should scroll-left and scroll-right buttons.
The indicators token indicates if the Carousel should display indicator buttons for direct navigation to its panels.
The activeIndex token indicates which panel should be active. This index is zero-indexed.
The numberOfIndicators token indicates how many indicator buttons should be presented.
The html content for the widget.

page.title: Carousel Panel
page.paragraph: The Carousel Panel Widget specifies a panel within a Carousel. This widget is only valid as the immediate child of a Carousel.

The Card Header Widget can be viewed on the
Style Guide Landing
page.
page.title: Widget
page.paragraph: The Carousel Panel Widget is a Flex Container, in addition to having the following properties.

cell.paragraph: The src property specifies an image in the materials that will be presented as the background for the panel. This property is required.
This property specifies if this panel is active when the Carousel first loads.
The interval property specifies the wait period for the specific panel, if autoSlide is set to true on the parent Carousel.

page.title: Template
page.paragraph: The template for the widget is the carousel-panel.ftl file. It takes the following tokens.

cell.paragraph: A unique id for the widget.
The active token is a boolean indicating if the current Carousel Panel is active or not.
The interval token is a number that indicates the wait period for the Carousel Panel if the Carousel is auto sliding.
The src token contains a path to an image to use for the Carousel Panel background.
The carouselId token contains the unique id of the containing Carousel.
A list of classes that should be applied.
A list of imageClasses that should be applied to the image element.
The css styles that should be applied in order to support Flex Container definitions.
The html content for the widget.

page.title: Cell
page.paragraph: The Cell Widget specifies a cell within a table. The Cell Widget must be the immediate child of a Row Widget. When a Table Widget is specifies, it will immediately compose Row Widgets. The first Row Widget might contain Column Widgets. All subsequent Rows must contain Cells. The Cell Widgets would then contain the actual content of the table cells.

The Cell Widget can be viewed on the
Style Guide Alpha
page as a part of a Table.
page.title: Widget
page.paragraph: The Cell Widget is a Flex Container.
page.title: Template
page.paragraph: The template for the widget is the cell.ftl file. It takes the following tokens.

cell.paragraph: A unique id for the widget.
A list of classes that should be applied.
The css styles that should be applied in order to support Flex Container definitions.
The html content for the widget.

page.title: Close Workflow Executed Panel
page.paragraph: The Close Workflow Executed Panel Widget specifies that the panel of the same name should present. When a Workflow is first initiated, the platform will present the Workflow Executed Page. This page should indicate that the Workflow that has just executed, has executed. There must be a button on this page that tells the platform to continue. That is the purpose of this widget.
page.title: Widget
page.paragraph: The Close Workflow Executed Panel Widget is a Flex Item.
page.title: Template
page.paragraph: The template for the widget is the close-workflow-executed-panel.ftl file. It takes the following tokens.

cell.paragraph: A unique id for the widget.
The CSRF token for the form submit.
A list of classes that should be applied.
The css styles that should be applied in order to support Flex Item definitions.
The testMode token indicates if the widget should render in test mode, which typically disables any button or link clicks.
The action token contains the url for the action attribute of the form.

page.title: Column
page.paragraph: The Column Widget specifies a column header within a table. The Column Widget must only be the immediate child of the first Row Widget within a Table. A Table does not need to have column headers.

The Column Widget can be viewed on the
Style Guide Alpha
page as a part of a Table.
page.title: Widget
page.paragraph: The Column Widget is a Textual.
page.title: Template
page.paragraph: The template for the widget is the column.ftl file. It takes the following tokens.

cell.paragraph: A unique id for the widget.
A list of classes that should be applied.
The css styles that should be applied in order to support Textual definitions.
The html content for the widget.

page.title: Confirm Workflow Panel
page.paragraph: The Confirm Workflow Panel Widget specifies that the panel of the same name should be presented. This panel presents an Accept and a Cancel button. When a Workflow is first initiated by the user, the Workflow Confirmation Page is presented. That page asks if the user is sure they wish to execute the Workflow. The user then confirms or cancels by selecting the appropriate button. These buttons are presented by this widget.
page.title: Widget
page.paragraph: The Confirm Workflow Panel Widget is a Flex Item.
page.title: Template
page.paragraph: The template for the widget is the confirm-workflow-panel.ftl file. It takes the following tokens.

cell.paragraph: A unique id for the widget.
The CSRF token for the form submit.
A list of classes that should be applied.
The css styles that should be applied in order to support Flex Item definitions.
The testMode token indicates if the widget should render in test mode, which typically disables any button or link clicks.
The action token contains the url for the action attribute of the form.

page.title: Confirmation Panel
page.paragraph: The Confirmation Panel Widget is used in two phase authentication. This panel presents a challenge to the user where he should enter a given number of letters at specific positions in a secret phrase. This widget belongs in a specially named page called the Confirmation Page. This functionality is currently not active.
page.title: Widget
page.paragraph: The Confirmation Panel Widget is a Flex Item and Textual.
page.title: Template
page.paragraph: The template for the widget is the confirmation-panel.ftl file. It takes the following tokens.

cell.paragraph: A unique id for the widget.
The CSRF token for the form submit.
A list of classes that should be applied.
The css styles that should be applied in order to support Flex Item definitions.
The testMode token indicates if the widget should render in test mode, which typically disables any button or link clicks.
The action token contains the url for the action attribute of the form.

page.title: Cookie Consent
page.paragraph: The Cookie Consent Widget will present a request to the user to agree to the presence of cookies on the browser.

The Cookie Consent Widget can be viewed on the
Style Guide Beta
page.
page.title: Widget
page.paragraph: The Cookie Consent Widget is a Flex Item.
page.title: Template
page.paragraph: The template for the widget is the confirmation-panel.ftl file. It takes the following tokens.

cell.paragraph: A unique id for the widget.
The CSRF token for the form submit.
The css styles that should be applied in order to support Flex Item definitions.
The testMode token indicates if the widget should render in test mode, which typically disables any button or link clicks.
The action token contains the url for the action attribute for the form.

page.title: Def
page.paragraph: The Def Widget is short for 'default'. It contains the default content for presentation when a Switch Widget is specified. It will not present if any If Widget within the Switch evaluates to true.

The Def Widget can be viewed on the
Style Guide Specials
page.
page.title: Widget
page.paragraph: The Def Widget is a Flex Container.
page.title: Template
page.paragraph: The Def Widget does not have a mapping to a template. Its contents become the content for the enclosing Switch if no If Widget resolves to true.
page.title: Div
page.paragraph: The Div Widget is short for 'division'. It is intended to facilitate dividing the page up so that we can apply structure to the page. Divs are ubiquitous and are present on all the style guides, however they are not visible.
page.title: Widget
page.paragraph: The Div Widget is a Flex Item and Flex Container.
page.title: Template
page.paragraph: The template for the widget is the div.ftl file. It takes the following tokens.

cell.paragraph: A unique id for the widget.
A list of classes that should be applied.
The css styles that should be applied in order to support Flex Item definitions.
The css styles that should be applied in order to support Flex Container definitions.
The html content for the widget.

page.title: Email
page.paragraph: The Email Widget is the root element for defining an email page.
page.title: Widget
page.paragraph: The Email Widget is a Flex Container.
page.title: Template
page.paragraph: The template for the widget is the email.ftl file. It takes the following tokens.

cell.paragraph: A unique id for the widget.
The css styles that should be applied in order to support Flex Container definitions.
The html content for the widget.

page.title: Email Confirmation Link
page.paragraph: The Email Confirmation Link Widget is only used in the Email Confirmation Email that is one of the predefined pages that must be defined. You can see the file in the 'emails' directory. This widget will present a link that allows for the confirmation of the email address to be verified as a part of the registration process.
page.title: Widget
page.paragraph: The Email Confirmation Link Widget is a Flex Item in addition to the following properties.

cell.paragraph: The text to display for the user to click on the link.

page.title: Template
page.paragraph: The template for the widget is the email-confirmation-link.ftl file. It takes the following tokens.

cell.paragraph: A unique id for the widget.
The href property specifies the value for the href property.
The css styles that should be applied in order to support Flex Item definitions.
The css styles that should be applied in order to support Textual definitions.
The label for the link.

page.title: Enumeration Input
page.paragraph: The Enumeration Input Widget will present either a select drop-down or a series of checkboxes or radio buttons. The values that can be selected are always predefined and hence the name. Multiple values or single values can be selected. The Enumeration Input Widget is only valid within a Form as a part of a Wizard. The only exception is as a part of the style guides.

The Enumeration Input Widget can be viewed on the
Style Guide Delta
page.
page.title: Widget
page.paragraph: The Email Widget is a Flex Item in addition to the following properties.

cell.paragraph: The label to display on the form for presentation.
The reference attribute specifies the name of the key when this value is inserted into the JSON result as the Wizard is completed.
The type of value that this enumeration will offer. The values offered by the enumeration must all be of the same type.
The cardinality specifies the number of values that may be selected from the available enumeration.
The style attribute specifies if the presentation should be orientated around checkboxes and radio buttons, or whether a select input field should be used.
The required attribute specifies if this input must have a value. If the value is required, then a validation error will present if no value is selected.
This attribute contains a Plantain script that will determine if the Widget should appear disabled or not.
The size of the input field.
This attribute contains a Plantain script that will determine if the Widget should appear hidden or not.

page.title: Template
page.paragraph: The template for the widget is the enumeration-input.ftl file. It takes the following tokens.

cell.paragraph: A unique id for the widget.
A list of classes that should be applied.
The css styles that should be applied in order to support Flex Item definitions.
The value token holds the current value for the Enumeration Input.
The label token holds the label that should be presented as text in association with the input.
The type token holds the data type for the enumeration.
The name token specifies the name that the Enumeration Input should hold for the purposes of inclusion into the results.
The cardinality token specifies whether the input should be single select or multiple.
The size of the input field.
The style attribute specifies if the presentation should be orientated around checkboxes and radio buttons, or whether a select input field should be used.

The values token contains a list of values for population in the enumeration. These are the options that should be offered to the user. Each value is an object that has the properties Key, Value and Panel. Key is the property that should be returned if the user selects the Value. Value is the property that should be presented to the user. If the Value is selected, and there is an associated Panel property, then the Panel property will contain html content that should be displayed. The intention is that the Panel html content is only visible if the associate value is selected.
The disabled token is a boolean value that specifies if the Enumeration Input should be disabled or not.
The panels token is a boolean value that specifies if the Enumeration Input has panels or not.
The error token specifies an error message if there has been some validation error associated with the Enumeration Input.

page.title: Error Summary
page.paragraph: The Error Summary Widget will present a panel outlining all the errors that exist on the current Form. The Error Summary should only ever be a child of a Form.

The Enumeration Input Widget can be viewed on the
Style Guide Delta
page.
page.title: Widget
page.paragraph: The Error Summary Widget is a Flex Item.
page.title: Template
page.paragraph: The template for the widget is the error-summary.ftl file. It takes the following tokens.

cell.paragraph: A unique id for the widget.
A list of classes that should be applied.
The css styles that should be applied in order to support Flex Item definitions.
The errors token contains all the errors that should be presented. The token is a map of key value pairs where the keys are the names or references for inputs and the values are error messages.

page.title: Form
page.paragraph: The Form Widget is the root of any web page that is a part of a Wizard.
The Form Widget does not have a visual component.
page.title: Widget
page.paragraph: The Form Widget is a Flex Container.
page.title: Template
page.paragraph: The template for the widget is the form.ftl file. It takes the following tokens.

cell.paragraph: A unique id for the widget.
The css styles that should be applied in order to support Flex Container definitions.
The CSRF token for the form submit.
The html content for the form.
The action token contains the url for the action attribute of the form.

page.title: Horizontal Rule
page.paragraph: The Horizontal Rule Widget presents a horizontal line across the page, that visually separates the content above and below.

The Horizontal Rule Widget can be viewed on the
Style Guide Specials
page.
page.title: Widget
page.paragraph: The Horizontal Rule Widget has no properties.
page.title: Template
page.paragraph: The template for the widget is the horizontal-rule.ftl file. There are no tokens.
page.title: Icon
page.paragraph: The Icon Widget presents an icon on the page. This very much depends on the implementation the developer includes with the Materials.

The Icon Widget can be viewed on the
Style Guide Landing
page.
page.title: Widget
page.paragraph: The Form Widget is a Flex Item in addition to the following properties.

cell.paragraph: The name of the icon to present. The meaning of the name will depend on the implementation of the icon system used. For example in Bootstrap, the name 'car-front-fill' will present a car icon facing towards the viewer.

row.cell: The size attribute specifies the size of the Icon.
The flavour attribute determines the colour of the icon.
DEFAULT, PRIMARY, INFO, WARNING, DANGER, SUCCESS, MUTED, BLACK, WHITE

page.title: Template
page.paragraph: The template for the widget is the icon.ftl file. It takes the following tokens.

cell.paragraph: A unique id for the widget.
A name token contains the name of the icon and depends on the icon system used.

row.cell: The size attribute specifies the size of the Icon.

cell.paragraph: A list of classes that should be applied.
The css styles that should be applied in order to support Flex Item definitions.

page.title: If
page.paragraph: The If Widget is composed within a Switch Widget. Its contents are conditionally rendered depending on the associated Plantain Script and the current context.

The If Widget can be viewed on the
Style Guide Specials
page.
page.title: Widget
page.paragraph: The If Widget is a Flex Container and has the following properties.

cell.paragraph: The Plantain Script that will execute. It must evaluate to a boolean result.

page.title: Template
page.paragraph: The If Widget does not have a mapping to a template. Its contents become the content for the enclosing Switch if its condition script resolves to true.
page.title: Image
page.paragraph: The Image Widget presents an image on the page.

The Icon Widget can be viewed on the
Style Guide Landing
page.
page.title: Widget
page.paragraph: The Form Widget is a Flex Item in addition to the following properties.

cell.paragraph: The src attribute specifies the image that should be displayed. Only images from the Materials are allowed.

row.cell: The alt attribute translates to the alt property in HTML.
The imageHeight property specifies the image height.
The imageWidth property specifies the image width.
The border property translates at the border attribute in HTML.
The borderRadius property translates at the borderRadius attribute in HTML.
The objectFit property translates at the objectFit attribute in HTML.
The objectPosition property translates at the objectPosition attribute in HTML.
The opacity property translates at the opacity attribute in HTML.
The background property translates at the background attribute in HTML.

page.title: Template
page.paragraph: The template for the widget is the image.ftl file. It takes the following tokens.

cell.paragraph: A unique id for the widget.
A imageStyles token contains all the css styling that should be applied to the image.
The css styles that should be applied in order to support Flex Item definitions.
The alt token contains the text that should be included in the alt property for the image.
The src token contains the path to the image to use for the image.

page.title: Initiate Workflow Button
page.paragraph: The Initiate Workflow Button Widget presents a button on the page that will initiate a Workflow.

The Initiate Workflow Button Widget can be viewed on the
Style Guide Specials
page.
page.title: Widget
page.paragraph: The Initiate Workflow Button Widget is a Flex Item in addition to the following properties.

cell.paragraph: The workflow attribute specifies the name of the workflow that should be initiated. The name comprises three parts in this format group:name:version.

Set the showCasePrincipalPicker attribute if the user should be presented with the Case Principal Picker Page after clicking this button. That page allows the current user to assign the initiated workflow to another user as the Case Principal.

row.cell: The size attribute specifies the size of the button.

cell.paragraph: The colouring of the button.

row.cell: DEFAULT, PRIMARY, INFO, WARNING, DANGER, SUCCESS, MUTED, BLACK, WHITE

cell.paragraph: This attribute contains a Plantain script that will determine if the Widget should appear disabled or not.

page.title: Template
page.paragraph: The template for the widget is the initiate-workflow-button.ftl file. It takes the following tokens.

cell.paragraph: A id for the button. This must be included in order for some of the button functionality to work.
A list of classes that should be applied.
The size of the widget.
The css styles that should be applied in order to support Flex Item definitions.
The css styles that should be applied in order to support Textual definitions.
The content of the widget.
The testMode token indicates if the widget should render in test mode, which typically disables any button or link clicks.
The disabled token indicates if the button should be disabled or not.
The CSRF token for the form submit.
The action token contains the url for the action attribute of the form.
The showCasePrincipalPicker token contains a boolean string that must be included as a hidden field within the enclosing form.

page.title: Input
page.paragraph: The Input Widget presents a input field that accepts data entry from the user.

The Input Widget can be viewed on the
Style Guide Delta
page.
page.title: Widget
page.paragraph: The Input Widget is a Flex Item in addition to the following properties.

cell.paragraph: The label attribute specifies the text used to present to the user the purpose of the input field.
The reference attribute specifies the name of the key used when the value is included in the resulting JSON document, that is the Wizard's output.
The type attribute specifies the type of the data that will be collected. This affects how the Input Widget is presented and how validation is done.

row.cell: INPUT, TEXTAREA, CHECKBOX, NUMBER, DATE, DATETIME, CURRENCY

cell.paragraph: The value attribute specifies the initial value of the input.

The validationPattern attribute specifies a regular expression for the purposes of validating the value of the input. This attribute only applies if the underlying data type is a string. The type for the input would have to be INPUT or TEXTAREA.
The min attribute specifies a minimum value that is valid for the current input value. This attribute only applies to numbers and dates and their variants.
The max attribute specifies a maximum value that is valid for the current input value. This attribute only applies to numbers and dates and their variants.
The cols attribute specifies the number of columns for the text area. This property only applies to text area.
The rows attribute specifies the number of rows for the text area. This property only applies to text area.
The size of the Input Widget.
The maxLength of the value. This only applies to values that are strings. The Input Widget would have to have a type of INPUT or TEXTAREA.
The maxLength of the value. This only applies to values that are strings. The Input Widget would have to have a type of INPUT or TEXTAREA.
The required attribute specifies if this input must have value. If the value is required, then a validation error will present if no value is supplied.
This attribute contains a Plantain script that will determine if the Widget should appear disabled or not.
This attribute contains a Plantain script that will determine if the Widget should appear hidden or not.

page.title: Template
page.paragraph: The template for the widget is the input.ftl file. It takes the following tokens.

cell.paragraph: A id for the button. This must be included in order for some of the button functionality to work.
A list of classes that should be applied.
The css styles that should be applied in order to support Flex Item definitions.
The value token holds the current value for the Enumeration Input.
The label token holds the label that should be presented as text in association with the input.
The type token holds the data type for the enumeration.
The name token specifies the name that the Enumeration Input should hold for the purposes of inclusion into the results.
The min token specifies the minimum value the input should allow if the type is NUMBER or one of the date types.
The max token specifies the maximum value the input should allow if the type is NUMBER or one of the date types.
The cols token specifies the number of columns the text area should present.
The rows token specifies the number of rows the text area should present.
The size of the widget.
The maxLength token species the maximum length of the input when the type is INPUT or TEXTAREA
The currencySymbol token species the currency symbol for use when presenting the CURRENCY input type.
The disabled token indicates if the button should be disabled or not.
The error token specifies an error message if there has been some validation error associated with the Enumeration Input.

page.title: Inset Text
page.paragraph: The Inset Text Input Widget presents a panel where the content presents in a highlighted fashion but is also related to the current text on the page. This is as apposed to a Well Widget that includes content that is intended to be more distinctly separated from the context on the current page.

The Inset Text Widget can be viewed on the
Style Guide Alpha
page.
page.title: Widget
page.paragraph: The Inset Text Widget is a Flex Item and Flex Container in addition to the following properties.

cell.paragraph: The flavour property specifies the colouring of the Inset Text.

row.cell: DEFAULT, PRIMARY, INFO, WARNING, DANGER, SUCCESS, MUTED, BLACK, WHITE

page.title: Template
page.paragraph: The template for the widget is the inset-text.ftl file. It takes the following tokens.

cell.paragraph: A id for the button. This must be included in order for some of the button functionality to work.
A list of classes that should be applied.
The css styles that should be applied in order to support Flex Item definitions.
The css styles that should be applied in order to support Flex Container definitions.
The content of the widget.

page.title: Jumbotron
page.paragraph: The Jumbotron Widget presents a panel where the content presents in a very loud way that is intended to be the feature item for a landing page.

The Jumbotron Widget can be viewed on the
Style Guide Landing
page.
page.title: Widget
page.paragraph: The Jumbotron Widget is a Flex Item and Flex Container.
page.title: Template
page.paragraph: The template for the widget is the jumbotron.ftl file. It takes the following tokens.

cell.paragraph: A id for the button. This must be included in order for some of the button functionality to work.
A list of classes that should be applied.
The css styles that should be applied in order to support Flex Item definitions.
The css styles that should be applied in order to support Flex Container definitions.
The content of the widget.

page.title: Link
page.paragraph: The Link Widget presents a link on the page.

The Link Widget can be viewed on the
Style Guide Alpha
page.
page.title: Widget
page.paragraph: The Link Widget is a Flex Item and Textual in addition to the following properties.

cell.paragraph: The type property specifies if the link is an internal or external link.
The view property specifies which internal page to link to. This property is only valid, if the link is an internal link.
The url property specifies an external url that this link will link to.
The openNewWindow property will specify if, when clicked, the browser will present the destination view or url in a separate window.

page.title: Template
page.paragraph: The template for the widget is the link.ftl file. It takes the following tokens.

cell.paragraph: A unique id for the widget.
The href property specifies the value for the href property.
The value for the rel attribute.
The value for the target attribute.
A list of classes that should be applied.
The css styles that should be applied in order to support Flex Item definitions.
The css styles that should be applied in order to support Textual definitions.
The content of the widget.

page.title: List
page.paragraph: The List Widget presents a list of items on the page.
The List Widget can be viewed on the Index page.
page.title: Widget
page.paragraph: The List Widget is a Flex Item in addition to the following properties.

cell.paragraph: The listStyle property specifies the style of the list.

page.title: Template
page.paragraph: The template for the widget is the list.ftl file. It takes the following tokens.

cell.paragraph: A unique id for the widget.
The listStyle token specifies the styling of the List Item.
The content of the widget.
A list of classes that should be applied.
The css styles that should be applied in order to support Flex Item definitions.

page.title: List Item
page.paragraph: The List Item Widget presents an item in a list on the page. The List Item is the only valid immediate child of a List Widget.
The List Item Widget can be viewed on the Index page.
page.title: Widget
page.paragraph: The List Item Widget is a Flex Container.
page.title: Template
page.paragraph: The template for the widget is the list-item.ftl file. It takes the following tokens.

cell.paragraph: A unique id for the widget.
The listStyle token specifies the styling of the List Item.
The content of the widget.
A list of classes that should be applied.
The css styles that should be applied in order to support Flex Container definitions.

page.title: Login Panel
page.paragraph: The Login Panel Widget presents the Login Panel. The Login Panel is a special component that specifies that the page should present a login form for the user to enter his credentials in order to authenticate onto the Platform.

The Login Panel Widget can be viewed on the
Style Guide Specials
page.
page.title: Widget
page.paragraph: The Login Panel Widget is a Flex Item.
page.title: Template
page.paragraph: The template for the widget is the login-panel.ftl file. It takes the following tokens.

cell.paragraph: A unique id for the widget.
The CSRF token for the form submit.
The css styles that should be applied in order to support Flex Item definitions.
The enablePrivacyPolicyAgreementOnLogin token specifies if the user must check the tick box on login that agrees to the Privacy Policy Document.
The enableRegistration token specifies if the Register Button should be presented.
The testMode token indicates if the widget should render in test mode, which typically disables any button or link clicks.
The action token contains the url for the action attribute for the form.
The errors token contains all the errors that should be presented. The token is a map of key value pairs where the keys are the names or references for inputs and the values are error messages.

page.title: Loop
page.paragraph: The Loop Widget is one of the flow control widgets. It has no visual component. It is used to specify that the page should loop over some list structure in order to produce output. It is unlikely to be useful in the predefined pages.

The Loop Widget can be viewed on the
Style Guide Specials
page.
page.title: Widget
page.paragraph: The Loop Widget has the following properties.

cell.paragraph: The reference property specifies a list as a data source form the current context. In Plantain terms, it specifies a Path.

page.title: Template
page.paragraph: The template for the widget is the loop.ftl file. This template is rendered for each item in the Loop. It takes the following tokens.

cell.paragraph: A unique id for each item.
The content token contains the content of the item.

page.title: Menu
page.paragraph: The Menu Widget is presents a menu or navigational panel on the page. It is used to present a large body of links in a concise way to the user that can link to pages, or initiate workflows. The Menu Widget must only contain Menu Brand, Sub Menu and Menu Item widgets.

The Menu Widget can be viewed on the
Style Guide Specials
page.
page.title: Widget
page.paragraph: The Menu Widget is a Flex Item in addition to the following properties.

cell.paragraph: The axis property specifies the orientation of the Menu Widget.

page.title: Template
page.paragraph: The template for the widget is the menu.ftl file. It takes the following tokens.

cell.paragraph: A unique id for each item.
The css styles that should be applied in order to support Flex Item definitions.
A list of classes that should be applied.
The content token contains the content of the item.
The menuBrand token contains the content for the Menu Brand child of this Menu widget.
The axis token specifies if the Menu should be presented in vertical or horizontal format.

page.title: Menu Brand
page.paragraph: The Menu Brand Widget presents the branding part of the Menu. This is the textual part that presents at the top left regardless of axis.

The Menu Brand Widget can be viewed on the
Style Guide Specials
page.
page.title: Widget
page.paragraph: The Menu Brand Widget is a Textual.
page.title: Template
page.paragraph: The template for the widget is the menu-brand.ftl file. It takes the following tokens.

cell.paragraph: A unique id for each item.
A list of classes that should be applied.
The css styles that should be applied in order to support Textual definitions.
The content token contains the content of the item.

page.title: Menu Item
page.paragraph: The Menu Item Widget presents a menu item that presents a link within the Menu. The link can either be to a page, or can initiate a workflow.

The Menu Item Widget can be viewed on the
Style Guide Specials
page.
page.title: Widget
page.paragraph: The Menu Item Widget is a Textual in addition to having the following properties.

cell.paragraph: The type property specifies if the Menu Item will link to a Page, or initiate a Workflow.
The page property specifies the Page that should be presented when clicked.
The workflow property specifies the Workflow that should be initiated when clicked.
The flavour property specifies the colouring of the link.

row.cell: DEFAULT, PRIMARY, INFO, WARNING, DANGER, SUCCESS, MUTED, BLACK, WHITE

cell.paragraph: This attribute contains a Plantain script that will determine if the Widget should appear disabled or not.
This attribute contains a Plantain script that will determine if the Widget should appear hidden or not.

page.title: Template
page.paragraph: The template for the widget is the menu-item.ftl file. It takes the following tokens.

cell.paragraph: A unique id for each item.
The CSRF token for the form submit.
The type token specifies if the Menu Item links to a Page, or will initiate a Workflow.
The href property specifies the value for the href property when the type property is set to 'page'.
The action property specifies the value for the action property that is generated when type is specified as 'workflow'.
A list of classes that should be applied.
The testMode token indicates if the widget should render in test mode, which typically disables any button or link clicks.
The disabled token indicates if the Menu Item should be disabled or not.
The css styles that should be applied in order to support Textual definitions.
The content token contains the content of the item.
The isInSubMenu token indicates if the Menu Item is enclosed within a Sub Menu.

page.title: Message Explorer
page.paragraph: The Message Explorer Widget presents a complex dialog that allows for searching and exploring the messages that reside in the queues on the Account. This widget is intended for members of staff where a high number of messages needs to be filtered using complex search criteria.

The Message Explorer Widget can be viewed on the
Style Guide Specials
page.
page.title: Widget
page.paragraph: The Message Explorer Widget is a Flex Item in addition to having the following properties.

cell.paragraph: The queue property specifies the initial queue that the Message Explorer will retrieve messages for.

page.title: Template
page.paragraph: The template for the widget is the message-explorer.ftl file. It takes the following tokens.

cell.paragraph: A unique id for the widget.

The bust token contains a unique id for each render of the message-explorer. This helps to prevent any caching issues that affect the render, and also impacts how the page maintains focus on the widget as it is refreshed.
The CSRF token for the form submit.
A list of classes that should be applied.
The css styles that should be applied in order to support Flex Item definitions.
The testMode token indicates if the widget should render in test mode, which typically disables any button or link clicks.
The values token contains a list of objects that specify the messages that need to be displayed.

row.cell:
List<{
wipId: string,
id: string,
kaseId: string,
date: string,
dateTime: string,
wizardId: string,
wizardTitle: string,
wizardDescription: string,
workflowId: string,
workflowTitle: string,
workflowDescription: string,
principal: string,
group: string,
queue: string,
action: string
}>

cell.paragraph: The workflows token contains a list of all the workflows for the purposes of populating the workflows filter.
The workflow token contains the current id for the workflow that has been applied to filter the values.
The wizards token contains a list of all the wizards for the purposes of populating the wizards filter.
The wizard token contains the current id for the wizard that has been applied to filter the values.
The queues token contains a list of all the queues for the purposes of populating the queues filter.
The queue token contains the current id for the queue that has been applied to filter the values.
The principal token contains the username of the case principal of the case that the message is related to that has been applied to filter the values.
The startIndex token contains a string that marks the start for the purposes of pagination.
The endIndex token contains a string that marks the end for the purposes of pagination.
The action token contains the url for the action attribute for the form.

page.title: Mile Stone
page.paragraph: The Mile Stone Widget specifies a milestone within the Progress Bar Widget. The milestone is the visual element that marks a level of progress in the Progress Bar. It is the only valid child of a Progress Bar Widget.

The Message Explorer Widget can be viewed on the
Style Guide Question
page.
page.title: Widget
page.paragraph: The Message Explorer Widget has the following properties.

cell.paragraph: The text presented in association with the milestone.
The condition property specifies a Plantain Script that will resolve to a boolean result. If true, then this milestone will be marked as active or complete.

page.title: Template
page.paragraph: The template for the widget is the mile-stone.ftl file. It takes the following tokens.

cell.paragraph: A unique id for the widget.
The label token contains the associated label for the Mile Stone.
The active token is a boolean indicating if the Mile Stone is active.
The tag token contains the text that should be displayed within the Mile Stone itself.
The mileStoneStyle token indicates the milestone style.
The labelSide token indicates on which side the labels should be presented.
A list of classes that should be applied.

page.title: Notification Banner
page.paragraph: The Notification Banner Widget presents a banner on the page that is intended to notify the user of some detail.
page.title: Widget
page.paragraph: The Notification Banner Widget is a Flex Item and Flex Container and has the following properties.

cell.paragraph: The text presented in association as a title on the Notification Banner Widget.
The flavour property specifies the colouring of the Notification Banner.

row.cell: DEFAULT, PRIMARY, INFO, WARNING, DANGER, SUCCESS, MUTED, BLACK, WHITE

page.title: Template
page.paragraph: The template for the widget is the notification-banner.ftl file. It takes the following tokens.

cell.paragraph: A id for the button. This must be included in order for some of the button functionality to work.
A list of classes that should be applied.
The css styles that should be applied in order to support Flex Item definitions.
The css styles that should be applied in order to support Flex Container definitions.
The content of the widget.
The title for the Notification Banner.
The flavour that determines the colouring of the banner.

row.cell: DEFAULT, PRIMARY, INFO, WARNING, DANGER, SUCCESS, MUTED, BLACK, WHITE

page.title: Page
page.paragraph: The Page Widget is the root element of any Page.
page.title: Widget
page.paragraph: The Page Widget is a Flex Container and has the following properties.

cell.paragraph: The title presented for the page. This forms the title as per the HTML spec, which affects the text presented for the browser, and the text shown in the page history.

page.title: Template
page.paragraph: The template for the widget is the page.ftl file. It takes the following tokens.

cell.paragraph: A unique id for the widget.
The css styles that should be applied in order to support Flex Container definitions.
The html content for the form.

page.title: Paragraph
page.paragraph: The Paragraph Widget is the most common and basic element that presents text on the page.
page.title: Widget
page.paragraph: The Paragraph Widget is a Flex Item and Textual has the following properties.

cell.paragraph: The paragraphStyle specifies the type of style the paragraph will have and is demonstrated by the possible values the property may have.

page.title: Template
page.paragraph: The template for the widget is the paragraph.ftl file. It takes the following tokens.

cell.paragraph: A unique id for the widget.
A list of classes that should be applied.
The css styles that should be applied in order to support Flex Item definitions.
The css styles that should be applied in order to support Textual definitions.
The label for the link.
The paragraphStyle token specifies the style for the paragraph.

page.title: Password Reset Link
page.paragraph: The Password Reset Link Widget is used expressly in the Password Reset Email. When a user requests a password reset, they are sent an email and within the email there will be a link. This widget specifies the inclusion and location of the link.
page.title: Widget
page.paragraph: The Paragraph Widget is a Flex Item and Textual has the following properties.

cell.paragraph: The label specifies the text that is shown in the email that presents as a link.

page.title: Template
page.paragraph: The template for the widget is the password-reset-link.ftl file. It takes the following tokens.

cell.paragraph: A unique id for the widget.
The href property specifies the value for the href property.
The css styles that should be applied in order to support Flex Item definitions.
The css styles that should be applied in order to support Textual definitions.
The label for the link.

page.title: Progress Bar
page.paragraph: The Progress Bar Widget presents a progress bar on the page. The Progress Bar Widget must only include Mile Stone Widgets as its children.

The Progress Bar Widget can be viewed on the
Style Guide Question
page.
page.title: Widget
page.paragraph: The Progress Bar Widget is a Flex Item has the following properties.

cell.paragraph: The axis specifies if the progress bar should be presented in vertical or horizontal form.
The size attribute specifies the size of the Mile Stone Widgets.
The flavour attribute specifies the colouring of the Progress Bar.

row.cell: DEFAULT, PRIMARY, INFO, WARNING, DANGER, SUCCESS, MUTED, BLACK, WHITE

cell.paragraph: The milestoneStyle attribute specifies the styling of the Progress Bar. This property affects how the Mile Stones present their order.

The labelSide attribute specifies the side on which the labels are presented. This is affected by the axis of the Progress Bar. If the axis is horizontal, then a preceding label would be above, and a following label, below. If the axis is vertical, then the label precedes or is on the left hand side, and if following, the right hand side.

page.title: Template
page.paragraph: The template for the widget is the progress-bar.ftl file. It takes the following tokens.

cell.paragraph: A unique id for the widget.
A list of classes that should be applied.
The css styles that should be applied in order to support Flex Item definitions.
The axis token specifies if the Progress Bar should be presented in vertical or horizontal format.
The content of the widget.
The size of the Progress Bar.

page.title: Register Panel
page.paragraph: The Register Panel Widget will present the Register Panel for the purposes of onboarding a new user to the Platform.

The Register Panel Widget can be viewed on the
Style Guide Specials
page.
page.title: Widget
page.paragraph: The Register Panel Widget is a Flex Item.
page.title: Template
page.paragraph: The template for the widget is the register-panel.ftl file. It takes the following tokens.

cell.paragraph: A unique id for the widget.
The CSRF token for the form submit.
The css styles that should be applied in order to support Flex Item definitions.
The timezones token contains all the timezones that should be presented to the user during registration.
The testMode token indicates if the widget should render in test mode, which typically disables any button or link clicks.
The action token contains the url for the action attribute for the form.
The title token contains the current value for the title field.
The username token contains the current value for the username field.
The firstName token contains the current value for the firstName field.
The lastName token contains the current value for the lastName field.
The email token contains the current value for the email field.
The contactNumber token contains the current value for the contactNumber field.
The dateOfBirth token contains the current value for the dateOfBirth field.
The passwordOnce token contains the current value for the passwordOnce field.
The passwordTwice token contains the current value for the passwordTwice field.
The timezone token contains the current value for the timezone field.
The isAcceptPrivacyPolicy token contains the current value for the isAcceptPrivacyPolicy field.
The errors token contains all the errors that should be presented. The token is a map of key value pairs where the keys are the names or references for inputs and the values are error messages.

page.title: Reset Password Panel
page.paragraph: The Reset Password Panel Widget will present the Reset Password Panel. As a part of the password reset process, the user will be sent an email with a link. When the user clicks on the link, he should be directed to the predefined Reset Password Page that includes this widget. The user will then be asked to enter his new password twice. This widget contains the form that implements this.

The Reset Password Panel Widget can be viewed on the
Style Guide Specials
page.
page.title: Widget
page.paragraph: The Reset Password Panel Widget is a Flex Item.
page.title: Template
page.paragraph: The template for the widget is the reset-password-panel.ftl file. It takes the following tokens.

cell.paragraph: A unique id for the widget.
The CSRF token for the form submit.
A list of classes that should be applied.
The css styles that should be applied in order to support Flex Item definitions.
The testMode token indicates if the widget should render in test mode, which typically disables any button or link clicks.
The action token contains the url for the action attribute for the form.
The errors token contains all the errors that should be presented. The token is a map of key value pairs where the keys are the names or references for inputs and the values are error messages.

page.title: Reset Password Request Panel
page.paragraph: The Reset Password Request Panel Widget will present the Reset Password Request Panel. As a part of the password reset process, the user is asked to supply an email address for the purposes of being sent a password reset link. This panel accepts the email address.

The Reset Password Request Panel Widget can be viewed on the
Style Guide Specials
page.
page.title: Widget
page.paragraph: The Reset Password Request Panel Request Widget is a Flex Item.
page.title: Template
page.paragraph: The template for the widget is the reset-password-request-panel.ftl file. It takes the following tokens.

cell.paragraph: A unique id for the widget.
The CSRF token for the form submit.
A list of classes that should be applied.
The css styles that should be applied in order to support Flex Item definitions.
The testMode token indicates if the widget should render in test mode, which typically disables any button or link clicks.
The action token contains the url for the action attribute for the form.
The current value for the email field.
The errors token contains all the errors that should be presented. The token is a map of key value pairs where the keys are the names or references for inputs and the values are error messages.

page.title: Row
page.paragraph: The Row Widget specifies a row within a table. The Row is the only valid immediate child of a Table. The Row Widget must only include either Cells or Columns.

The Row Widget can be viewed on the
Style Guide Alpha
page as a part of a Table.
page.title: Widget
page.paragraph: The Row Widget has no properties.
page.title: Template
page.paragraph: The template for the widget is the row.ftl file. It takes the following tokens.

cell.paragraph: A unique id for the widget.
A content for the widget.

page.title: Scale
page.paragraph: The Scale Widget will present a special purpose variant of the Enumeration Input Widget. Scales are really Enumerations, but their values are predefined. They also present in special ways. If you need the user to enter a value betwen 1 and 10, or to indicate how they feel from Very Bad to Very Good, then the Scale Widget fulfills the need.

The Scale Widget can be viewed on the
Style Guide Delta
page.
page.title: Widget
page.paragraph: The Email Widget is a Flex Item in addition to the following properties.

cell.paragraph: The label to display on the form for presentation.
The reference attribute specifies the name of the key when this value is inserted into the JSON result as the Wizard is completed.
The style attribute specifies if the presentation should be orientated around checkboxes and radio buttons, or whether a select input field should be used.
The value attribute specifies if this initial value of the Scale Widget.
The required attribute specifies if this input must have a value. If the value is required, then a validation error will present if no value is selected.
This attribute contains a Plantain script that will determine if the Widget should appear disabled or not.
This attribute contains a Plantain script that will determine if the Widget should appear hidden or not.
The size of the input field.

page.title: Template
page.paragraph: The template for the widget is the scale.ftl file. It takes the following tokens.

cell.paragraph: A unique id for the widget.
A list of classes that should be applied.
The css styles that should be applied in order to support Flex Item definitions.
The value token holds the current value for the Enumeration Input.
The label token holds the label that should be presented as text in association with the input.
The name token specifies the name that the Scale Input should hold for the purposes of inclusion into the results.
The size of the input field.
The scaleType specifies the type of Scale that should be rendered.

The values token contains a list of values for population in the widget. These are the options that should be offered to the user. Each value is an object that has the properties Key and Value. Key is the property that should be returned if the user selects the Value. Value is the property that should be presented to the user.
The disabled token is a boolean value that specifies if the Enumeration Input should be disabled or not.
The error token specifies an error message if there has been some validation error associated with the Enumeration Input.

page.title: Script
page.paragraph: The Script Widget will execute a Plantain Script that will evaluate to a string value that will be output where the Script tag is specified. The Script Widget is very useful in workflows to display values that users have previously supplied. They are less useful, in the context of Pages since the only real values that are available are from the %profile% and %userdata% variables and only if the current user is not anonymous.
The Script Widget will only form part of a Textual element's content.
page.title: Widget
page.paragraph: The Script Widget has the following attributes.

cell.paragraph: The Plantain Script.

page.title: Template
page.paragraph: The template for the widget is the script.ftl file. It takes the following tokens.

cell.paragraph: The text token contains the text that should be rendered as a result of executing the script.

page.title: Span
page.paragraph: The Span Widget is a Textual element that can be composed within other Textuals. What this means practically, is that it has the Textual attributes that affect font styling. A Span is distinct from a Paragraph, in that the Span is not a Flex Item. It offers no information on how it should be positioned on a Page. Elements in Textuals are laid out in flow orientation, meaning from left to right with text wrapping.
The Script Widget will only form part of a Textual element's content.
page.title: Widget
page.paragraph: The Span element is a Textual.
page.title: Template
page.paragraph: The template for the widget is the span.ftl file. It takes the following tokens.

cell.paragraph: A unique id for the widget.
A list of classes that should be applied.
The css styles that should be applied in order to support Textual definitions.
The content for the widget.

page.title: Sub Menu
page.paragraph: The Sub Menu Widget specifies that a Sub Menu should be presented within a Menu Widget. The Sub Menu should only ever be the immediate child of a Menu Widget. The Sub Menu can compose Sub Menu Label Widgets and Menu Items. Multiple levels of Sub Menu are not supported.

The Sub Menu Widget can be viewed on the
Style Guide Specials
page.
page.title: Widget
page.paragraph: The Sub Menu Widget has the following properties.

cell.paragraph: The flavour attribute specifies the colouring of the Sub Menu.

row.cell: DEFAULT, PRIMARY, INFO, WARNING, DANGER, SUCCESS, MUTED, BLACK, WHITE

page.title: Template
page.paragraph: The template for the widget is the sub-menu.ftl file. It takes the following tokens.

cell.paragraph: A unique id for each item.
A list of classes that should be applied.
The label token contains the rendered html for the Sub Menu Label.
The content token contains the Menu Items of the widget.
The hasContent token indicates if the Sub Menu has any content.

page.title: Sub Menu Label
page.paragraph: The Sub Menu Label Widget specifies a label for a Sub Menu.

The Sub Menu Label Widget can be viewed on the
Style Guide Specials
page.
page.title: Widget
page.paragraph: The Sub Menu Label Widget is a Textual.
page.title: Template
page.paragraph: The template for the widget is the sub-menu-label.ftl file. It takes the following tokens.

cell.paragraph: A unique id for each item.
A list of classes that should be applied.
The css styles that should be applied in order to support Textual definitions.
The rendered content for the Sub Menu Label.

page.title: Switch
page.paragraph: The Switch Widget is one of the flow control widgets. It has no visual component. It is used to specify that content should conditionally apply. The Switch Widget can only have either a Def Widget or an If Widget for content. Only one Def Widget is allowed, and it is mandatory.

The Switch Widget can be viewed on the
Style Guide Specials
page.
page.title: Widget
page.paragraph: The Switch Widget has no properties.
page.title: Template
page.paragraph: The template for the widget is the switch.ftl file. It takes the following tokens.

cell.paragraph: A unique id for each item.
A list of classes that should be applied.
The css styles that should be applied in order to support Flex Item definitions.
The rendered content for the Switch.

page.title: Table
page.paragraph: The Table Widget presents a table on the page. The only valid immediate child of a Table Widget is a Row Widget.

The Table Widget can be viewed on the
Style Guide Portfolio
page.
page.title: Widget
page.paragraph: The Table Widget is a Flex Item.
page.title: Template
page.paragraph: The template for the widget is the table.ftl file. It takes the following tokens.

cell.paragraph: A unique id for each item.
A list of classes that should be applied.
The css styles that should be applied in order to support Flex Item definitions.
The rendered content for the widget.

page.title: Title
page.paragraph: The Title Widget presents a title on the page.

The Title Widget can be viewed on the
Style Guide Alpha
page.
page.title: Widget
page.paragraph: The Title Widget is a Flex Item and Textual in addition to the following properties.

cell.paragraph: The size attribute specifies the size or weight of the title.

page.title: Template
page.paragraph: The template for the widget is the title.ftl file. It takes the following tokens.

cell.paragraph: A unique id for the widget.
A list of classes that should be applied.
The css styles that should be applied in order to support Flex Item definitions.
The css styles that should be applied in order to support Textual definitions.
The label for the link.
The size for the Title.

page.title: Tool Tip
page.paragraph: The Tool Tip Widget is a special purpose widget that is meant to be used in the style guides only. It presents a light bulb or similar icon near the wrapped element that will present some exposition when the mouse hovers over the icon.
page.title: Widget
page.paragraph: The Tool Tip Widget is a Flex Item and Flex Container in addition to the following properties.

cell.paragraph: The text to show when the mouse hovers over the icon.

page.title: Template
page.paragraph: The template for the widget is the tool-tip.ftl file. It takes the following tokens.

cell.paragraph: A unique id for the widget.
A list of classes that should be applied.
The css styles that should be applied in order to support Flex Item definitions.
The label for the link.
The exposition token contains the text that should be displayed in the tool tip.

page.title: Tray
page.paragraph: The Tray Widget is a special widget that displays Messages that represent Wizards for the current user to complete. When the Tray Widget is configured, a Queue is specified. When the Tray renders, the Platform will retrieve the Messages from the Queue and filter the messages according to the Groups that the current user possesses. The resulting Messages are displayed, and if the user clicks on one of them, the associated Wizard will load. The Tray Widget is intended to be used for public consumption as opposed to the Message Explorer, that does a similar job.

The Tray Widget can be viewed on the
Style Guide Specials
page.
page.title: Widget
page.paragraph: The Tray Widget is a Flex Item in addition to the following properties.

cell.paragraph: The queue from which to extract messages.

page.title: Template
page.paragraph: The template for the widget is the tray.ftl file. It takes the following tokens.

cell.paragraph: A unique id for the widget.
A trayHeader token contains the content for presenting the Tray Header.
The CSRF token for the form submit.
A list of classes that should be applied.
The values token contains a list of objects that specify the messages that need to be displayed.

row.cell:
List<{
wipId: string,
id: string,
kaseId: string,
date: string,
dateTime: string,
wizardId: string,
wizardTitle: string,
wizardDescription: string,
workflowId: string,
workflowTitle: string,
workflowDescription: string,
principal: string,
action: string
}>

cell.paragraph: The testMode token indicates if the widget should render in test mode, which typically disables any button or link clicks.
The css styles that should be applied in order to support Flex Item definitions.

page.title: Tray Header
page.paragraph: The Tray Header Widget contains the header content for the Tray. The Tray Header must have an immediate Tray Parent.

The Tray Header Widget can be viewed on the
Style Guide Specials
page.
page.title: Widget
page.paragraph: The Tray Header Widget is a Textual.
page.title: Template
page.paragraph: The template for the widget is the tray-header.ftl file. It takes the following tokens.

cell.paragraph: A list of classes that should be applied.
The css styles that should be applied in order to support Textual definitions.
The label for the link.

page.title: User Explorer
page.paragraph: The User Explorer Widget offers a widget that allows the current user to find other users within the Account. This facility is specifically useful in two ways: The Case Principal Picker Page must include this widget and allows a member of staff to assign a specific user to an initiated Workflow as Case Principal. The second usage, is as a part of the Message Explorer. The Message Explorer Widget offers a mechanism to find a user's username in order to filter messages by.

The User Explorer Widget can be viewed on the
Style Guide Specials
page.
page.title: Widget
page.paragraph: The User Explorer Widget is a Flex Item.
page.title: Template
page.paragraph: The template for the widget is the user-explorer.ftl file. It takes the following tokens.

cell.paragraph: A unique id for the widget.

The bust token contains a unique id for each render of the message-explorer. This helps to prevent any caching issues that affect the render, and also impacts how the page maintains focus on the widget as it is refreshed.
The CSRF token for the form submit.
A list of classes that should be applied.
The css styles that should be applied in order to support Flex Item definitions.
The testMode token indicates if the widget should render in test mode, which typically disables any button or link clicks.
The values token contains a list of objects that specify the messages that need to be displayed.

row.cell:
List<{
id: string,
username: string,
title: string,
firstName: string,
