lastName: string,
email: string,
contactNumber: string,
dateOfBirth: string,
lastLoggedIn: string,
}>

cell.paragraph: The groups token contains a list of all the groups for the purposes of populating the groups filter.
The group token contains the current id for the group that has been applied to filter the values.
The workflow token contains the current id for the workflow that has been applied to filter the values.
The wizard token contains the current id for the wizard that has been applied to filter the values.
The queue token contains the current id for the queue that has been applied to filter the values.
The principal token contains the username of the case principal of the case that the message is related to that has been applied to filter the values.
The startIndex token contains a string that marks the start for the purposes of pagination.
The endIndex token contains a string that marks the end for the purposes of pagination.
The executeWorkflow token contains the action url for use when initiating a workflow.
The messageExplorerMode token is a boolean value that indicates if the User Explorer is running as a sub dialog of the Message Explorer.
The username token contains the current username that should be applied to filtering the user search.
The firstName token contains the current firstName that should be applied to filtering the user search.
The lastName token contains the current lastName that should be applied to filtering the user search.

page.title: UUID
page.paragraph: The UUID Widget is a special widget that can be included in a Form. It has no visual component. What it does is include a UUID in the Wizard Result data.
page.title: Widget
page.paragraph: The UUID Widget has the following properties.

cell.paragraph: The reference attribute specifies the name of the key to use when including the UUID in the resulting data.

page.title: Template
page.paragraph: The template for the widget is the uuid.ftl file. It takes the following tokens.

cell.paragraph: A unique id for the widget.
A name token contains the name that should be used for the hidden input field.
A value token contains the value that should be used for the hidden input field.

page.title: Validation Rule
page.paragraph: The Validation Rule Widget is a special purpose widget that applies an additional validation rule to the current Form. The Validation Rule must have an Error Summary parent. It does not have a visual component, but may generate a text message that is displayed in the Error Summary Widget. It is particularly useful when you have a rule that applies to the interaction between multiple inputs, or an input and the current data context.

The Validation Rule Widget can be viewed on the
Style Guide Delta
page.
page.title: Widget
page.paragraph: The Validation Rule Widget is a Flex Item in addition to having the following properties.

cell.paragraph: The script property specifies a Plantain Script that evaluates to a boolean result. If the rule evaluates to true, then the message is included.

page.title: Template
page.paragraph: The template for the widget is the validation-rule.ftl file. It takes the following tokens.

cell.paragraph: A unique id for the widget.
A list of classes that should be applied.
The css styles that should be applied in order to support Textual definitions.
The label for the link.

page.title: Value
page.paragraph: The Value Widget specifies a value for an Enumeration Input Widget. It is the only valid immediate child of an Enumeration Input Widget.

The Value Widget can be viewed on the
Style Guide Delta
page.
page.title: Widget
page.paragraph: The Warning Widget is a Flex Container and has the following properties.

cell.paragraph: The label of the option in the Enumeration.
The key is inserted into the Wizard Result when the value is selected from the Enumeration.
The def property marks if this value is the default value for the Enumeration.
The panel property indicates if this value should have an associated panel or not. If the value is selected and this value is true, then the contents of the Value Widget will be rendered.
This attribute contains a Plantain script that will determine if the Value Panel should appear hidden or not. The Value will still appear.

page.title: Template
page.paragraph: For Values, the template only takes affect if the Value is marked as having a panel. The template for the widget is the value-panel.ftl file. It takes the following tokens.

cell.paragraph: A unique id for the widget.
A list of classes that should be applied.
A key for the value.
The css styles that should be applied in order to support Flex Container definitions.
The content of the widget.

page.title: Warning
page.paragraph: The Warning Widget is a special purpose widget that behaves like a Div Widget. The difference is that the Warning Widget displays an alert icon.

The Warning Widget can be viewed on the
Style Guide Alpha
page.
page.title: Widget
page.paragraph: The Warning Widget is a Flex Item and Flex Container.
page.title: Template
page.paragraph: The template for the widget is the warning.ftl file. It takes the following tokens.

cell.paragraph: A unique id for the widget.
A list of classes that should be applied.
The css styles that should be applied in order to support Flex Item definitions.
The css styles that should be applied in order to support Flex Container definitions.
The html content for the widget.

page.title: Well
page.paragraph: The Well Widget presents a panel where the content presents in a highlighted fashion but is separated from the content in the page somehow. This is opposed to the Inset Text Widget that is somehow related to the content.

The Well Widget can be viewed on the
Style Guide Beta
page.
page.title: Widget
page.paragraph: The Well Widget is a Flex Item and Flex Container in addition to the following properties.

cell.paragraph: The flavour property specifies the colouring of the Well.

row.cell: DEFAULT, PRIMARY, INFO, WARNING, DANGER, SUCCESS, MUTED, BLACK, WHITE

page.title: Template
page.paragraph: The template for the widget is the well.ftl file. It takes the following tokens.

cell.paragraph: A id for the button. This must be included in order for some of the button functionality to work.
A list of classes that should be applied.
The css styles that should be applied in order to support Flex Item definitions.
The css styles that should be applied in order to support Flex Container definitions.
The content of the widget.

page.title: Wizard Test Results
page.paragraph: The Wizard Test Results Widget renders a panel that presents the result of a Wizard Test. This Widget should only be used in this specific case, and it belongs in the Wizard Test Results Page.

The Well Widget can be viewed on the
Style Guide Beta
page.
page.title: Template
page.paragraph: The template for the widget is the wizard-test-results.ftl file. It takes the following tokens.

cell.paragraph: A id for the button. This must be included in order for some of the button functionality to work.
A list of classes that should be applied.
The content of the widget.
